description: Few-shot examples for Metadata Extractor. Shows how to extract gamepiece metadata from game specifications. Each example includes an abbreviated input spec (focused on gamepiece-relevant details) and the expected JSON output.

examples.name: Simple Game - Rock Paper Scissors
examples.input_spec: Rock, Paper, Scissors. Players simultaneously choose from 3 options: rock, paper, or scissors. Rock beats scissors, scissors beats paper, paper beats rock.
examples.notes: Simple game with identical pieces. No expansion needed. Each instance gets a brief description explaining its role.

gamepiece_types.description: Player choices in Rock, Paper, Scissors

instances.name: Rock
instances.brief_description: A closed fist representing a rock. Beats scissors, loses to paper.

instances.name: Paper
instances.brief_description: An open hand representing paper. Beats rock, loses to scissors.

instances.name: Scissors
instances.brief_description: Two fingers forming scissors. Beats paper, loses to rock.

examples.name: Standard Template - Poker Deck
examples.input_spec: Texas Hold'em poker using a standard 52-card deck. Each player receives 2 hole cards (private), and 5 community cards are dealt face-up in phases (flop, turn, river). Players make the best 5-card hand.
examples.notes: Uses standard template. When template is specified, instances array is empty (template defines all instances). No expansion needed for standard components.

gamepiece_types.description: Standard 52-card poker deck with 4 suits (hearts, diamonds, clubs, spades) and 13 ranks (A, 2-10, J, Q, K)

examples.name: Complex Game - Fantasy Creatures
examples.input_spec: Fantasy card battle game with 100 unique creature cards. Each creature has attack, defense, mana cost, and special abilities like flying, first strike, or spell casting. Players build decks of 40 cards and summon creatures to battle opponents.
examples.notes: Complex unique instances requiring expansion. Brief descriptions include hints about rarity (rare/common/uncommon), power level (high/medium/low), theme (fire/ice/nature), and role (attacker/defender/support). These hints guide Content Generator.

gamepiece_types.description: Unique creature cards with varied stats and special abilities

instances.name: Fire Drake
instances.brief_description: A rare, high-powered fire-themed attacker. A fierce dragon that breathes fire and rules the volcanic mountains. Expected to have high attack, medium defense, flying ability.

instances.name: Ice Wizard
instances.brief_description: A common, medium-powered ice-themed support character. A master of frost magic who can freeze enemies in their tracks. Expected to have medium attack, low defense, freezing spell ability.

instances.name: Forest Guardian
instances.brief_description: An uncommon, medium-powered nature-themed defender. An ancient treant protecting the sacred groves. Expected to have low attack, high defense, healing or regeneration ability.

examples.name: Multiple Types - Resource Game
examples.input_spec: Catan-style resource collection game. Players collect 5 types of resources: wood (19 cards), brick (19 cards), sheep (19 cards), wheat (19 cards), ore (19 cards). Resources are used to build settlements and roads. The game board has 19 terrain hexes that produce resources.
examples.notes: Multiple gamepiece types. Resource cards are semi-identical (grouped by type), so only one example instance per resource type is needed. Board spaces would be a separate gamepiece type.

gamepiece_types.description: Resource cards representing five resource types: wood, brick, sheep, wheat, and ore. Players collect and trade these to build.

instances.name: Wood
instances.brief_description: A resource card representing lumber from forests. Used for building roads and settlements.

instances.name: Brick
instances.brief_description: A resource card representing clay bricks from hills. Used for building roads and settlements.

instances.name: Sheep
instances.brief_description: A resource card representing wool from pastures. Used for building settlements and development cards.

instances.name: Wheat
instances.brief_description: A resource card representing grain from fields. Used for building settlements and cities.

instances.name: Ore
instances.brief_description: A resource card representing metal from mountains. Used for building cities and development cards.

gamepiece_types.description: Hexagonal terrain tiles that produce resources when their number is rolled. Five terrain types corresponding to the five resources.

instances.name: Forest
instances.brief_description: A forest hex that produces wood when its number is rolled.

instances.name: Hills
instances.brief_description: A hills hex that produces brick when its number is rolled.

instances.name: Pasture
instances.brief_description: A pasture hex that produces sheep when its number is rolled.

instances.name: Fields
instances.brief_description: A fields hex that produces wheat when its number is rolled.

instances.name: Mountains
instances.brief_description: A mountains hex that produces ore when its number is rolled.

instances.name: Desert
instances.brief_description: A desert hex that produces no resources.
